intro: Erythrodes vesicifera, commonly known as the bladder bladder, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking red, tubular flowers that bloom in summer. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific care to flourish.
